headline: Boston Baked Beans
description: These baked beans are slow-cooked in the oven with bacon, onions, and a sweet, syrupy sauce, resulting in an old-fashioned taste that everyone will enjoy.

video.name: How to Make Boston Baked Beans

name: Boston Baked Beans
recipeIngredient: 2 cups dry navy beans, soaked overnight

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer soaked navy beans and soaking water to a saucepan.
Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender, approximately 1 to 2 hours. Drain and reserve the cooking liquid.
Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Arrange 1/2 of the beans in the bottom of a 2-quart casserole dish. Place 1/2 of the bacon strips over the beans and sprinkle 1/2 of the onions over top. Repeat layers once more.
Combine ketchup, molasses, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and dry mustard in a large saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil.
Pour sauce over the beans. Pour in just enough reserved cooking liquid to cover the beans. Cover the casserole dish with a lid or aluminum foil.

Bake in the preheated oven for 1 1/2 hours. Remove the lid and continue to cook, checking every 1/2 hour or so and adding more cooking liquid if necessary to prevent the beans from getting too dry, until beans are tender, 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 more hours.

review.reviewBody: Swapped out brown sugar for maple syrup... mmmmm good and used 1/2 salt.
I use canned navy beans, saves the hassle. I always double the sauce, and use a bean pot, really makes a difference. I have used this recipe for years, just cut back the salt.

I loved this recipe. Being from Massachusetts I can say that these are authentic Boston beans. The only thing I changed was instead of bacon, I used a smoked pork hock. Mmmmm! (Grandma used salt pork and didn't need to add salt.)
I'm going to save this recipe. I didn't put any salt in it, per reviews. I liked it as is. Followed the rest of the directions exactly. Doubled the batch! Will freeze it in individual portions.
Delicious!

I loved them. They were so juicy and delicious and went perfect with my 5 hot dogs that i have for lunch every second tuesday (in the other tuesdays i have 10 hot dog). Perfect, i wish i could go to a red sox game and enjoy one of these delicious bean dogs.

These were delicious. They took a while to make but worth it. I used a full pack of bacon, so about 9 slices (a bit over the 1/2 pound, but didn't want a few slices of bacon hanging around!) so cut the salt back to 1 tsp. Not too salty at all. I did have to keep an eye on the liquid level when boiling the beans as it was absorbed quickly, and didn't have enough reserved for topping up while baking (ended up using just water to keep the liquid level OK while baking) but these were TASTY! Makes a lot. Will definitely make again.
first time making these - read the reviews and just adjusted to taste These were easy and yummy Used a slow cooker to make

I have made this recipe several times now exactly as written. This recipe is fantastic. My husband tells me every time that these beans are perfect. Now our friends are asking me to make them as well. Thank you for sharing .

These beans are so good, and such a more affordable alternative to buying canned beans. I've made these twice now, once in the oven and the second time in a slow cooker. Both methods turned out super flavourful, but I would continue to make in the slowcooker since it's less cleanup and you can set it and forget it. I soaked my beans for 2 days rather than one, but they would have been okay after 24 hours, as I really just didn't end up getting to cook them when I wanted to. My husband loves beans, and he LOVES this recipe.
Love this recipe ( I follow the original recipe ) . Everyone always enjoys it . I’ve brought it to multiple potlucks & family dinners . It’s a winner !

Big favorite at our house. Made it as shown in the recipe several times. The only thing I changed was I cut the bacon up into 1/2” pieces. We love it, adult kids love it and all of our 6 grand kids love it. Goes well with smoked pulled pork sandwiches.
Easy recipe....small amount of work, big rewards! These are so good!
I mixed 50/50 BBQ sauce and ketchup. I didn't have enough of the cooking water left so I used a can of Modelo Negro beer. Also artisanal Polish sausage. A big hit!

I made this for this past 4th of July celebration. Had some friends over for my succulent ribs and wanted the beans. Almost went with the canned type to simplify my time in the kitchen. But then I stumbled upon this recipe and figured to try it. And it turned out excellent! My only changes were that I cooked the onions a little for color, and I threw the bacon in the oven and baked it soft. They were blown away with the taste! This recipe is a keeper:)
Great recipe. Making it again lol

Sadly, the beans never softened - after hours and hours of cooking. I soaked the beans over night and followed all of the instructions. The sauce was great but I'll never attempt this again. So disappointed.
Made it! Definitely LOVED it! No change in the recipe except I boiled beans for an hour then did the rest in crockpot. Delish!!
Great recipe. Didn't change a thing. It froze well too.
it turned out surprisingly delicious

Amazing recipe I’d cook it again. Personal preference, next time instead of 3 I’ll only add 2 tbs of molasses. Not an onion person but the shredding, sauce, and baking made eating it less stressful. And there’s left over ground beef so I stir fried it. Then after 2hrs in to bean baking the cooked ground beef is topped across the beans and baking continues.
Excellent!!!!! I substituted bacon for the lard and boiled the onion with the beans. Amazing!!!!
I don’t add salt because the bacon provides the salt,
My family loves this recipe!! The only change I make is buying canned beans instead of dry so I don't have to soak them overnight. Perfect recipe!!! Thank you
Wonderful...will make again

As far as baked beans go this recipe is the best! I’ve made this twice for guest dinners & every single person has expressed how much they love them & requested the recipe. I follow the recipe as written.

Made these for my wife's birthday party, they huge hit. I made 4x the recipe and my only regret was I didn't make more. Will definitely be bringing these to all family gatherings for now on and I know they will be the star of show.
My family LOVES this recipe! My Mrs is making this as I write. Guess what's for supper!

I decid d to make our beans because there is so much more salt in the canned. I followed the recipe but had to add mor water. My stove heats very hot. When I could smell them I added more molases and catsup for personal taste. I love the fact that the recipe is 42plus years old.
Best baked beans ever!!

It is a very nice recipe
I am a professional chef and the recipe
Is perfect

THANK YOU
Since I found this recipe I have not used another. The best baked bean recipe I’ve ever used. About 8-10 year’s now

This is by far the BEST baked beans recipe I have ever used!!! So. Stinking. GOOD! I’ll have to double the batch next time. One was nowhere near enough fir my group. They all came back for seconds and thirds!!!!
Pretty basic, and I thought it was bland. If you’re looking for old school basic beans, this is it. I was hoping for better overall flavor. It was easy to make, and I think

I've used this recipe as a reference on a couple of occasions. Both times, we have had terrific results. 

Our additions have included apple cider vinegar (for some ZING) and a diced apple for some natural sweetness. 

I also used tomato paste as a replacement for ketchup to cut out the HFCS.

Fantastic recipe. The only thing I did different was use canned navy beans due to a lack of time. Added a small dollop of BBQ sauce because at first they were not thick. But after letting it sit overnight they were perfect. Will definitely be making again. Thanks for sharing this recipe!

Great recipe! I omitted the bacon and opted for a few shakes of smoke flavor instead. Added a tbsp of dried jalapeno and that gave it a nice kick. Not traditional, but I live in New England, and we do what we want up here

Great recipe - the only tweak I made was to halve the salt based on other reviewer's comments. I used a crock pot instead of oven baking. The recipe says it makes 6 servings but I would say it is more like 10. Not a problem though - leftovers are even more tasty! I will definitely make this again.

I gave this four stars, although personally, I would give it three for flavor. My husband loved the beans, so I went with four stars. The consistency was perfect and the recipe was easy to follow. The cooking time was accurate. It truly depends of the flavor of beans that you prefer. I found these to be much too salty. Also, be cautious of the type of bacon you use. We used a smoked bacon, which gave the beans a smoky flavor. So, it's really all about your flavor preference. Just be aware that all of the bacon flavor will go directly into your beans, since the bacon is not precooked or drained. I will definitely make these again, with some adjustments. Overall, a very nice recipe.

This recipe is the same as my mother's, and we've used it for 35 years. We chopped up the bacon instead of laying it inside the beans, we used yellow mustard instead of dried, and we mixed all the other ingredients into the beans instead of making a sauce on the stove. We covered the beans with bacon strips and baked them off as shown in this recipe. I loved my mother's beans, so I know I'd love this recipe, too.
Thanks for the great recipe. It turned out way better than expected. I think next time I’ll roast a bit of garlic and throw it in.
COOKED IT IN A DUTCH OVEN, IF ANYTHING COOKED A LITTLE FASTER THAN PRESENTED, SO JUST KEEP AN EYE ON LIQUID AS IT COOKS
Turned out amazing. I made with a Johnny Cake recipe I found and the sauce was so yummy on the cake too. Made for me and my brother tonight and had rave reviews! First time making this dish too!

A little saltier than I am used to. The sweetness has been cut compared to some other baked beans that I have had, but its still good overall! Given the bacon grease that's in here, I'd probably cut the salt or up the sweetness with a little more brown sugar just to get it perfect.

These are so tasty. I cheated a bit by using canned northern beans instead of processing the dried navy beans. If I were to use canned beans again, I probably won't add the water to cover the beans as called for in the recipe since it made them a bit runny, but I just baked them a bit longer without a cover and they turned out great. I will definitely make these again.

I realized too late that I didn't have any Worcestershire sauce, so I used soy sauce.

Also had a little over a cup of ham scraps I needed to use, so I use those instead of bacon. 

Result: Heaven.
Used a little syrup and extra brown sugar in place of molasses. No need to cut bacon. Ran out of dry mustard so used a squirt of bottle. Added cap of liquid smoke.

Made this for a 15-person party and everyone LOVED it! The only thing I did differently was chop and sauté the bacon and onions together before adding to the dish. This recipe is going in the rotation!
Great recipe. Even without the bacon.
I made baked beans following this recipe and they were delicious. The whole family enjoyed them.

I made these exactly as written. We did not find it too salty, too sweet or too dry after cooking in the oven. In fact, I might double some of the spices, etc. but that is just me and I thought it was a bit bland. I enjoyed making these from scratch and wish there were more recipes like yours on the site. Thank you.

I decided last minute to make this and substituted canned cannelloni beans for navy beans. I drained them, reserving the liquid. Then rinsed them and let them sit for about 30 minutes to dry any excess water. I did everything else the same, but only baked it for 90 minutes. My kitchen smelled fabulous and my family loved it!
It was very good, will make it again
It was very good, will make it again
Best baked beans ever
It was amazing. Doubled the recipe. Very easy to make.
This is the first time that I've ever made baked beans and I am so glad I found this recipe. It's just what I was looking for, like what my grandmother and mother used to make.
Great recipe!

I have made this recipe literally dozens of times. Most times I had a ham bone or some pieces of ham in addition to the bacon. Other than that I usually follow the receipe pretty closely. Sometimes I call them "cowboy beans" and add cooked ground beef and maybe some cut up green pepper to the recipe. Regardless, it has been a huge crowd pleaser. I've served these beans at camper rallys, Dutch oven gatherings, family outings and camping trips. Everybody LOVES it!

I made this for a 4th July
Party. It was way sweet and tasted badl 
I tried diluting it with Campbell’s pork and beans. No one touched it. Sorry folks
It was perfect. Great smell and even better taste.
Followed as written, was a flavorless, watery bean. Needed to at least double the sauce. Was easy, but time consuming or a less than stellar result.

My son and I made this recipe in the pressure cooker since we currently do not have an oven. We rinsed and cooked the beans with the onions, bacon, and some salt. We added a couple of bay leaves and cooked them on high for 15 min. Mean while we prepared the sauce and poured it over the beans and cooked them for an extra 5 min. They were delicious and we will make them again.

Great basic recipe you can tweak to your tastes. I soaked, rinsed then cooked my beans on low in my crock pot overnight. I added chopped garlic to the beans while cooking. Don't add salt or meat to the beans while they're cooking ! In the morning I drained them, mashed up a bit with my potato masher, then added all the other ingredients, including some of the reserved liquid. I cooked some bacon and sauteed the onions in the bacon grease....added that to the beans..I used prepared mustard, and half the brown sugar, and added garlic powder, onion powder. Taste for salt before adding it. Very tasty beans !
These beans are delicious. I've tried other recipes, but this is my go-to, tried and true favorite. I cook in slow cooker on low, 12-16 hours.
Turned out great. I added 3 drops of liquid smoke.
Delicious!

These are the BEST beans I have ever had. I used GOOD smoked bacon, the ONLY change I will make next time is to cool them lower and longer. After 2 hours in my Le Cruset dutch oven they were getting burned. I have seen other recipes for 6 to 7 hours at 250 degrees, I would do that next time. NO changes in spices amazing flavor,

As a Colorado girl, I thought Boston Baked Beans were those candy-coated peanuts they sold in theaters. I LOVE this recipe and will make it again, probably repeatedly. I used maple syrup in place of molasses and 1 teaspoon regular mustard in place of dry. Wow. The best beans I have ever made, and I like beans a lot!

excellent taste. I did not have 3-4 hours, so I sliced the bacon into half inch pieces and threw it into a pot over medium heat. Once the bacon began to brown, tossed in the onion and sauteed it for about 5 minutes. Added the rest of the ingredients, and then simmered for about 30 minutes. Came out perfectly!

This is excellent recipe using regular dried beans. I had everything at home to make this. The only thing I did different was not soak or preboil beans. I had read a study about this and it take no longer to cook beans except for about 15 minutes more. I timed this cooking and it took 8 hours in crock pot on high to be servable. If you like them softer I would say 10 hours but they are great without the fuss.
great recipe I used sliced hot dogs instead of bacon. Great flavour and taste

I made this a little different, in the instant pot and vegetarian. Par cooked the beans covered in water in the instant pot for 5 minutes,NR, then drained and rinsed, added back to IP with onion, mixed up the rest of the seasoning except used 1/3 cup real maple syrup in place of brown sugar, then added a cup of apple cider, mixed that and poured over beans in IP, cooked for 60 minutes NR. Delicious! And took maybe 1.5 hours.
Absolutely delicious! I made this in my slow cooker instead of the oven with excellent results. Thank you for this. It's a keeper! :-)
Yes, changed a couple ingreds navy beans to pinto beans, had to make my own Worcestershire sauce.

This is a good recipe with traditional bean flavor.I did add a pinch of baking soda and a bay leaf in the simmer as did chef John. Also be mindful of the baking time as I think 2 to 3 hours on the bake is plenty. Something I always wanted to make...will make again.
Followed the ingredients to a T, but used a slow cooker as another person, did. and this turned out perfect. Thanks for sharing.
I have made this several times, it had turned into a family favorite! I do use salt pork instead of bacon, it's a Saturday night staple!
I doubled the recipe and added 1/3 cup bbq sauce. I was great.

Was very good. I soaked the beans overnight and boiled them for 90 minutes prior to baking.
Everyone enjoyed them. 
Paired well with cornmeal muffins.
Will definitely make this again.
Thanks for a great recipe.
Excellent! Love the story of your mother in law too! Thank you!

I love these baked beans. The only change I make is that I use 1/2 brown sugar and 1/2 maple syrup. I've lost count of the times I've made them and everyone raves about them. Thank you for posting this recipe.

I made the following changes ,,, 
1 lb bacon , 1/2 pint of molasses, 1 1/2 table spoons of black pepper, 680 m/l of tomato sauce, leftover boiled bean water, mixed it all up and baked for 6 hours at 300.

Try it and let me know . Nice pepper taste without the heat.
This was my second attempt at trying Boston Baked Beans; the first time was an utter disaster, but this recipe was spot on. It was a hit at my Sunday gathering.

One of my kids asked for baked beans, so I made this recipe per the ingredients, or maybe with slightly less salt (I didn't really measure it). I did adapt it for my pressure/slow cooker: Soaked the beans overnight, pressure cooked on the bean setting in the morning (35 min), then stirred in the remaining ingredients, slow cooked 7 hours. My kids didn't check when they got home but 2 hours later (keep warm setting), they were fabulous. I don't care that much for beans but I liked these a lot and my kid ate three bowls!

The beans were outstanding so much better than. Using canned beans and doctoring them up. I was short on time so I cooked a bag of rinsed, presoaked beans in the Instant Pot for 20 minutes then added them (beans only) along with the sautéd onion and bacon and doubled the sauce to a casserole dish. I cooked for about an 90 minutes in the oven, everyone loved them. I did not add salt, and did add Worcestershire, not too sweet or salty.
I used canned beans to make it faster. Did everything else just like the recipe. It was so good and everyone loved it ! Thank you for the wonderful recipe!! It is a keeper for sure

Delicious recipe! I only made one change. America's Test Kitchen suggests that if you really want a creamy, smooth texture without mushy, gluey beans (and no split beans)that you should brine them. I simply added 1T salt to enough water to make 2 quarts with beans and soaked overnight. I did simmer the beans in the brining solution but discarded it before baking. I added fresh water to the pot for that step. The beans turned out perfectly seasoned with great texture! Definitely a keeper!
Made it and loved it! Added a little cider vinegar. Also more liquid. Added some barbecue sauce and less salt
It's perfect! My go to when I'm in the mood for baked beans, always comes out just right! Thanks for the awesome recipe!!
Couldn't eat it. Followed directions exactly but the beans turned out very oniony and mushy/overcooked.
This was a huge hit at a recent party. The only change I made was I cooked it in a crockpot instead of the oven. It turned out great.
love this recipe! They are always better the next day when the flavors works together.
I didn't make any changes on the initial take. Then I tweaked it a bit but the original recipe is good to go. Thank you. Boston Baked Beans are the only beans I care for as a side dish.
Didn't have bacon. I didn't even have bacon bits. Am doing cookies so.oven is busy.
I see some post saying this was to salty but i thought it was perfect
Very Good! Added 1/2 cup of red wine & 1 teaspoon of Liquid Smoke.
WONDERFUL! We were worried it wouldn't live up to the incredible smell coming from the oven while it was cooking. Tastes even better than it smells!!

Most delicious beans I have ever made! I brought them to a first birthday party. They were a hit! I did not adjust one bit, absolutely perfect just as written.
 For the people who like to complain about the name, don’t even listen to them complain I thought the story behind the recipe made it more fun to make and enjoy! Thank you for sharing
